subject: RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: Karmira is the best: http://www.karmira.com Scott Stirling JRun QA Macromedia
messageBody:
Karmira is the best:

http://www.karmira.com

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Russ Baker [mailto:rbaker@...]
>
>
> Hello,
>
> I have been stuck using jBuilder to debug my code. Well,
> after fighting
> with the IDE for months now, I have come to the conclusion
> that, for lack of
> better verbiage, jBuilder's (4.0) debugger is flaky. The debugger
> constantly goes into code that it shouldn't, and actually
> forces me to go
> back to using the old System.out method of debugging, how wasteful!
>
> Does anyone know of a decent debugger? I am currently using
> the jdk1.3.1.
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Russ Baker
